69 #define RLS_ENABLE_NRESET_MASK (0x01)
70 #define RLS_ENABLE_SOP_MASK (0x02)
71 
75 #define RLS_FTDI_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT (500)
76 
77 #define RLS_CLR_BIT_ALL(value) (value = 0U)
78 #define RLS_SET_BIT(value, bit) (value |= (1U<<(bit)))
79 #define RLS_CLR_BIT(value, bit) (value &= ~(1U<<(bit)))
80 #define RLS_GET_BIT(value, bit) (0U != (value & (1U<<(bit))))
81 
85 #define RLS_MSB_FALLING_EDGE_CLOCK_BYTE_IN (0x24)
86 #define RLS_MSB_FALLING_EDGE_CLOCK_BYTE_OUT (0x11)
87 #define RLS_MSB_RISING_EDGE_CLOCK_BIT_IN (0x22)
88 #define RLS_MSB_FALLING_EDGE_CLOCK_BIT_OUT (0x13)
89 /* SCL Freq=60/((1+0x4A)*2)(MHz)=400khz*/
90 #define RLS_I2C_CLOCK_DIVIDER (0x4A)
91 
95 #define RLS_PORTA_BIT0_SPICLK1 (1)
96 #define RLS_PORTA_BIT1_MOSI1 (1<<1)
97 #define RLS_PORTA_BIT2_MISO1 (0<<2)
98 #define RLS_PORTA_BIT3_CS1 (1<<3)
99 #define RLS_PORTA_BIT4_TSWCONN_MONITOR_END1 (0<<4)
100 #define RLS_PORTA_BIT5_120PIN_TMPSNS_ALERT (0<<5)
101 #define RLS_PORTA_BIT6_FTDI_PMIC_NRST (1<<6)
102 #define RLS_PORTA_BIT7_PIN7_120PIN_NERROR_OUT (0<<7)
103 
107 #define RLS_PORTA_CONFIG ( RLS_PORTA_BIT0_SPICLK1 | \
108  RLS_PORTA_BIT1_MOSI1 | \
109  RLS_PORTA_BIT2_MISO1 | \
110  RLS_PORTA_BIT3_CS1 | \
111  RLS_PORTA_BIT4_TSWCONN_MONITOR_END1 | \
112  RLS_PORTA_BIT5_120PIN_TMPSNS_ALERT | \
113  RLS_PORTA_BIT6_FTDI_PMIC_NRST | \
114  RLS_PORTA_BIT7_PIN7_120PIN_NERROR_OUT )
115 
119 #define RLS_PORTB_BIT0_FTDI_1_I2C_SCL (1)
120 #define RLS_PORTB_BIT1_FTDI_1_I2C_SDA_DO (1<<1)
121 #define RLS_PORTB_BIT2_FTDI_1_I2C_SDA_D1 (0<<2)
122 #define RLS_PORTB_BIT3_UNUSED (1<<3)
123 #define RLS_PORTB_BIT4_120PIN_MUX_0 (1<<4)
124 #define RLS_PORTB_BIT5_12XX_1_HOST_INTR1 (0<<5)
125 #define RLS_PORTB_BIT6_120PIN_MUX_1 (1<<6)
126 #define RLS_PORTB_BIT7_12XX_1_HOST_INTR1 (0<<7)
127 
131 #define RLS_PORTB_CONFIG ( RLS_PORTB_BIT0_FTDI_1_I2C_SCL | \
132  RLS_PORTB_BIT1_FTDI_1_I2C_SDA_DO | \
133  RLS_PORTB_BIT2_FTDI_1_I2C_SDA_D1 | \
134  RLS_PORTB_BIT3_UNUSED | \
135  RLS_PORTB_BIT4_120PIN_MUX_0 | \
136  RLS_PORTB_BIT5_12XX_1_HOST_INTR1 | \
137  RLS_PORTB_BIT6_120PIN_MUX_1 | \
138  RLS_PORTB_BIT7_12XX_1_HOST_INTR1 )
139 
143 #define RLS_PORTC_PIN0_RSR232_Rx (0)
144 #define RLS_PORTC_PIN1_RSR232_Tx (1)
145 #define RLS_PORTC_PIN2_PIN_MONITOR (2)
146 #define RLS_PORTC_PIN3_12XX_4_NRST (3)
147 #define RLS_PORTC_PIN4_FTDI_1_NERRIN (4)
148 #define RLS_PORTC_PIN5_12XX_3_NRST (5)
149 #define RLS_PORTC_PIN6_12XX_1_2_NRST (6)
150 #define RLS_PORTC_PIN7_WARMRST (7)
151 
155 #define RLS_PORTC_BIT0_RSR232_Rx (1)
156 #define RLS_PORTC_BIT1_RSR232_Tx (0<<1)
157 #define RLS_PORTC_BIT2_PIN_MONITOR (0<<2)
158 #define RLS_PORTC_BIT3_12XX_4_NRST (1<<3)
159 #define RLS_PORTC_BIT4_FTDI_1_NERRIN (1<<4)
160 #define RLS_PORTC_BIT5_12XX_3_NRST (1<<5)
161 #define RLS_PORTC_BIT6_12XX_1_2_NRST (1<<6)
162 #define RLS_PORTC_BIT7_WARMRST (1<<7)

167 #define RLS_PORTC_CONFIG ( RLS_PORTC_BIT0_RSR232_Rx | \
168  RLS_PORTC_BIT1_RSR232_Tx | \
169  RLS_PORTC_BIT2_PIN_MONITOR | \
170  RLS_PORTC_BIT3_12XX_4_NRST | \

174  RLS_PORTC_BIT7_WARMRST )

179 #define RLS_PORTD_PIN0_ENABLE_ONBRD_CLK_BUFFER (0)
180 #define RLS_PORTD_PIN1_UART4_TX (1)
181 #define RLS_PORTD_PIN2_PMIC_OUT_SOR1 (2)

189 #define RLS_PORTD_BIT1_UART4_TX (1<<1)
190 #define RLS_PORTD_BIT2_PMIC_OUT_SOR1 (1<<2)
191 #define RLS_PORTD_BIT3_SYNC_OUT_SOR2 (1<<3)
192 #define RLS_PORTD_BIT4_TDO_SOR3 (1<<4)
193 #define RLS_PORTD_BIT5_12XX_SLAVE_SOP_PMICCLKOUT (1<<5)
194 #define RLS_PORTD_BIT6_12XX_SLAVE_SOP_SYNCOUT (1<<6)
195 #define RLS_PORTD_BIT7_12XX_SLAVE_SOP_TDO (1<<7)
196 
200 #define RLS_PORTD_CONFIG ( RLS_PORTD_BIT0_ENABLE_ONBRD_CLK_BUFFER | \
201  RLS_PORTD_BIT1_UART4_TX | \
202  RLS_PORTD_BIT2_PMIC_OUT_SOR1 | \
203  RLS_PORTD_BIT3_SYNC_OUT_SOR2 | \
204  RLS_PORTD_BIT4_TDO_SOR3 | \
205  RLS_PORTD_BIT5_12XX_SLAVE_SOP_PMICCLKOUT | \

207  RLS_PORTD_BIT7_12XX_SLAVE_SOP_TDO )

372 static int rlsLockDevice(rlsDevCtx_t* pDevCtx)
373 {
374  EnterCriticalSection(&pDevCtx->cs);
375  return RLS_RET_CODE_OK;
376 }
377 
378 static int rlsUnlockDevice(rlsDevCtx_t* pDevCtx)
379 {
380  LeaveCriticalSection(&pDevCtx->cs);
381  return RLS_RET_CODE_OK;
382 }
383 
391 static int rlsInitBoardControlPort( rlsDevCtx_t* pDevCtx )
392 {
393  FT_STATUS status;
394 
395  if( pDevCtx->boardControlHandle != 0 )
396  {
397  /*Reset the port*/
398  status = FT_SetBitMode( pDevCtx->boardControlHandle, 0x0,
399  FT_BITMODE_RESET );
400 
401  /* Set Timeout*/
402  status |= FT_SetTimeouts( pDevCtx->boardControlHandle, 500, 100 );
403 
404  /* Set USB Parameters*/
405  status |= FT_SetUSBParameters( pDevCtx->boardControlHandle, 4096,
406  4096 );
407 
408  /* Set Latency TImer*/
409  status |= FT_SetLatencyTimer( pDevCtx->boardControlHandle, 1 );
410  if (status != FT_OK)
411  {
412  DEBUG_PRINT("Board Control USB parameters config Error\n");
413  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_WR_ERROR;
414  }
415 
416  /* Enable Asynchronous Bit Bang Controller */
417  status = FT_SetBitMode(pDevCtx->boardControlHandle, RLS_PORTC_CONFIG,
418  FT_BITMODE_ASYNC_BITBANG);
419 
420  /* Set Baud Rate */
421  status |= FT_SetBaudRate( pDevCtx->boardControlHandle, 115200 );
422  if (status != FT_OK)
423  {
424  DEBUG_PRINT("Board Control Set bit modes Error\n");
425  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_WR_ERROR;
426  }
427  }
428 
429  return RLS_RET_CODE_OK;
430 }
431 
439 static int rlsInitGenericGPIOPort( rlsDevCtx_t* pDevCtx )
440 {
441  FT_STATUS status;
442 
443  if( pDevCtx->genericGPIOHandle != 0 )
444  {
445  /*Reset the port*/
446  status = FT_SetBitMode( pDevCtx->genericGPIOHandle, 0x0,
447  FT_BITMODE_RESET );
448 
449  /* Set Timeout*/
450  status |= FT_SetTimeouts( pDevCtx->genericGPIOHandle, 500, 100 ) ;
451 
452  /* Set USB Parameters*/
453  status |= FT_SetUSBParameters( pDevCtx->genericGPIOHandle, 4096, 4096 );
454 
455  /* Set Latency TImer*/
456  status |= FT_SetLatencyTimer( pDevCtx->genericGPIOHandle, 1 ) ;
457  if (status != FT_OK)
458  {
459  DEBUG_PRINT("Generic GPIO USB parameters config Error\n");
460  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_WR_ERROR;
461  }
462 
463  /* Enable Asynchronous Bit Bang Controller */
464  status = FT_SetBitMode( pDevCtx->genericGPIOHandle, RLS_PORTD_CONFIG,
465  FT_BITMODE_ASYNC_BITBANG );
466 
467  /* Set Baud Rate */
468  status |= FT_SetBaudRate( pDevCtx->genericGPIOHandle, 115200 ) ;
469  if (status != FT_OK)
470  {
471  DEBUG_PRINT("Generic GPIO Set bit modes Error\n");
472  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_WR_ERROR;
473  }
474  }
475 
476  return RLS_RET_CODE_OK;
477 }
478 
486 static int rlsInitIrqI2CPort(rlsDevCtx_t* pDevCtx)
487 {
488  FT_STATUS status;
489  char buffer[16];
490  char Buff[4096];
491  DWORD bytesSent;
492  DWORD BytesInQ;
493  DWORD dwCount;
494  DWORD BytesToTransfer;
495  DWORD BytesTransferred;
496  int bCommandEchod = 0;
497 
498  if( pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle != 0 )
499  {
500  /* Set Timeout*/
501  status = FT_SetTimeouts( pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle, 500, 100 );
502 
503  /*Disable event and error characters*/
504  status |= FT_SetChars( pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle, 0, 0, 0, 0 ) ;
505 
506  /* Set USB Parameters*/
507  status |= FT_SetUSBParameters( pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle, 4096, 4096 );
508 
509  /* Set Latency TImer*/
510  status |= FT_SetLatencyTimer( pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle, 1 ) ;
511  if (status != FT_OK)
512  {
513  DEBUG_PRINT("IRQ USB parameters config Error\n");
514  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_WR_ERROR;
515  }
516 
517  /* Enable MPSSE Controller */
518  status = FT_SetBitMode( pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle, RLS_PORTB_CONFIG,
519  FT_BITMODE_MPSSE ) ;
520  if (status != FT_OK)
521  {
522  DEBUG_PRINT("IRQ Set bit modes Error\n");
523  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_WR_ERROR;
524  }
525 
526  Sleep(50) ; /* Wait for all the USB stuff to complete and work*/
527 
528  /*
529  Below codes will synchronize the MPSSE interface by sending bad command 0xAA and checking
530  if the echo command followed by bad command 0xAA can be received, this will make sure the
531  MPSSE interface enabled and synchronized successfully
532  */
533  BytesToTransfer = 0;
534  buffer[BytesToTransfer++] = '\xAB' ; /*Add BAD command 0xAB*/
535  status = FT_Write( pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle, buffer, BytesToTransfer,
536  &BytesTransferred ) ;
537  /* Send off the BAD commands*/
538  BytesToTransfer = 0 ; /*Clear output buffer*/
539 
540  do
541  {
542  status = FT_GetQueueStatus(pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle, &BytesInQ);
543  // Get the number of bytes in the device input buffer
544  } while ((BytesInQ == 0) && (status == FT_OK));
545 
546 
547  FT_Read(pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle, &buffer[0], (BytesInQ), &BytesTransferred);
548 
549  for (dwCount = 0; dwCount < BytesTransferred; dwCount += 2) /*Check if Bad command and
550  echo command received*/
551  {
552  if ((buffer[dwCount] == '\xFA') && \
553  (buffer[dwCount + 1] == '\xAB'))
554  {
555  bCommandEchod = 1;
556  break;
557  }
558  }
559 
560  if (bCommandEchod == 0)
561  {
562  DEBUG_PRINT("Error - Can't receive echo command , fail to synchronize MPSSE interface\n");
563  }
564 
565  /* Clear Rx queue */
566  do
567  {
568  status |= FT_GetQueueStatus( pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle, &BytesInQ );
569  if (FT_OK != status)
570  {
571  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_TIMEOUT;
572  }
573  FT_Read( pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle, &buffer[0], (BytesInQ % 16),
574  &BytesTransferred ) ;
575  for (dwCount = 0; dwCount < BytesTransferred ; dwCount += 2) /*Check if Bad command and
576  echo command received*/
577  {
578  if ((buffer[dwCount] == '\xFA') && \
579  (buffer[dwCount+1] == '\xAA'))
580  {
581  bCommandEchod = 0;
582  break;
583  }
584  }
585  } while (BytesInQ > 0);
586 
587  /* Configure the MPSSE settings for I2C communication */
588  buffer[BytesToTransfer++] = '\x8A' ; /*Ensure disable clock divide by 5 for 60Mhz master clock */
589  buffer[BytesToTransfer++] = '\x97' ; /*Ensure turn off adaptive clocking */
590  buffer[BytesToTransfer++] = '\x8C' ; /*Enable 3 phase data clock, used by I2C to allow data
591  on both clock edges*/
592  /* Send off the commands */
593  status |= FT_Write( pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle, buffer, BytesToTransfer,
594  &BytesTransferred ) ;
595 
596  BytesToTransfer = 0 ; /*Clear output buffer*/
597  buffer[BytesToTransfer++] = '\x80' ; /*Command to set directions of lower 8 pins and
598  force value on bits set as output*/
599  buffer[BytesToTransfer++] = (0x03 | PMIC_MASK) ; /*Set SDA, SCL high and Read Modify Write of Mux Control Pin */ //4cascade
600  buffer[BytesToTransfer++] = RLS_PORTB_CONFIG ; /*Set SK,DO pins as output and DI pin as input*/
601 
602  /* The SK clock frequency can be worked out by below algorithm with divide by 5 set as off
603  SK frequency = 60MHz /( (1 + [(0xValueH*256) OR 0xValueL])*2)*/
604 
605  buffer[BytesToTransfer++] = '\x86' ; /*Command to set clock divisor*/
606  buffer[BytesToTransfer++] = (char)(RLS_I2C_CLOCK_DIVIDER & '\xFF') ; /*Set 0xValueL of clock divisor*/
607  buffer[BytesToTransfer++] = (char)((RLS_I2C_CLOCK_DIVIDER >> 8) & '\xFF') ; /*Set 0xValueH of clock divisor*/
608 
609  /* Send off the commands*/
610  status |= FT_Write( pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle, buffer, BytesToTransfer,
611  &BytesTransferred ) ;
612  BytesToTransfer = 0 ; /*Clear output buffer*/
613  Sleep(20); /*Delay for a while*/
614 
615  /*Turn off loop back in case*/
616  buffer[BytesToTransfer++] = '\x85' ; /*Command to turn off loop back of TDI/TDO connection*/
617 
618  /* Send off the commands*/
619  status |= FT_Write( pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle, buffer, BytesToTransfer,
620  &BytesTransferred ) ;
621  BytesToTransfer = 0; /*Clear output buffer*/
622 
623  if (status != FT_OK)
624  {
625  DEBUG_PRINT("IRQ and I2C MSPEE Config Error\n");
626  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_WR_ERROR;
627  }
628 
629  /* Clear Rx queue */
630  do
631  {
632  status = FT_GetQueueStatus( pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle, &BytesInQ );
633  if (FT_OK != status)
634  {
635  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_TIMEOUT;
636  }
637 
638  FT_Read( pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle, &Buff[0], (BytesInQ % 4096),
639  &bytesSent ) ;
640  } while( BytesInQ > 0 );
641 
642  if (0 != BytesInQ)
643  {
644  DEBUG_PRINT("Clear IRQ and I2C Queue Error\n");
645  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_RD_ERROR;
646  }
647  }
648  return RLS_RET_CODE_OK;
649 }
650 
651 static int rlsInitSpiPort(rlsDevCtx_t* pDevCtx)
652 {
653  FT_STATUS status;
654  char buffer[16];
655  DWORD bytesSent;
656  char Buff[4096];
657  DWORD BytesInQ;
658 
659  if(pDevCtx->spiHandle != 0)
660  {
661  /* Reset SPI device */
662  status = FT_SetBitMode( pDevCtx->spiHandle, 0x0, FT_BITMODE_RESET ) ;
663 
664  /* Set Timeout*/
665  status = FT_SetTimeouts( pDevCtx->spiHandle, 500, 500 );
666 
667  /* Set Usb Parameters*/
668  status |= FT_SetUSBParameters( pDevCtx->spiHandle, 4096, 4096 );
669 
670  /* Set Latency Timer */
671  status |= FT_SetLatencyTimer( pDevCtx->spiHandle, 16 ) ;
672  if (status != FT_OK)
673  {
674  DEBUG_PRINT("SPI USB parameters config Error\n");
675  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_WR_ERROR;
676  }
677 
678  /* Enable SPI Device */
679  status |= FT_SetBitMode( pDevCtx->spiHandle, RLS_PORTA_CONFIG,
680  FT_BITMODE_MPSSE );
681  if (status != FT_OK)
682  {
683  DEBUG_PRINT("MPSSE Init Error\n");
684  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_WR_ERROR;
685  }
686 
687  buffer[0] = 0x8A ; /* Use 60MHz master clock (disable divide by 5) */
688 
689  buffer[1] = 0x97 ; /* Turn off adaptive clocking (may be needed for ARM) */
690 
691  buffer[2] = 0x8D ; /* Disable three-phase clocking */
692 
693  buffer[3] = 0x86 ; /* Set divider command */
694 
695  buffer[4] = 0x02 ; /* Divider low value . 60Mhz/(((high+low)+1)*2)) */
696 
697  buffer[5] = 0x00 ; /* Divider high value */
698 
699  buffer[6] = 0x80 ; /* Configure initial state of pins command: */
700 
701  buffer[7] = 0xC8 ; /* initial value: */
702 
703  buffer[8] = RLS_PORTA_CONFIG ; /* Direction: */
704 
705  status = FT_Write( pDevCtx->spiHandle, buffer, 9, &bytesSent ) ;
706  if (status != FT_OK)
707  {
708  DEBUG_PRINT("MSPEE Config Error\n");
709  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_WR_ERROR;
710  }
711 
712  /* Clear Rx queue: */
713  do
714  {
715  status = FT_GetQueueStatus( pDevCtx->spiHandle, &BytesInQ );
716  if (FT_OK != status)
717  {
718  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_TIMEOUT;
719  }
720 
721  FT_Read( pDevCtx->spiHandle, &Buff[0], (BytesInQ % 4096),
722  &bytesSent ) ;
723  } while( BytesInQ > 0 );
724 
725  if (0 != BytesInQ)
726  {
727  DEBUG_PRINT("Clear SPI Queue Error\n");
728  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_RD_ERROR;
729  }
730  }
731  return RLS_RET_CODE_OK;
732 }
733 
734 
735 /*
736  return 0 if succeed to find and open SPI and Irq ports
737 */
738 static int rlsFindAndOpenDevice( rlsDevCtx_t* pDevCtx )
739 {
740  FT_STATUS ftStatus;
741  DWORD loopCounter;
742  DWORD numOfDevices;
743  FT_DEVICE_LIST_INFO_NODE* pInfoList;
744  int spiDevNumber;
745  int irqI2CDevNumber;
746  int boardControlDevNumber;
747  int genericGPIODevNumber;
748 
749  if(pDevCtx == NULL)
750  {
751  return RLS_RET_CODE_NULL_PTR_ERROR;
752  }
753 
754  /* If all the ports are opened and handles are updated return */
755  if( (pDevCtx->spiHandle != 0) && (pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle != 0)
756  && (pDevCtx->boardControlHandle != 0)
757  && (pDevCtx->genericGPIOHandle != 0))
758  {
759  /* all ports are already open */
760  return RLS_RET_CODE_OK;
761  }
762 
763  /* Create Device Information List */
764  ftStatus = FT_CreateDeviceInfoList(&numOfDevices);
765  if (FT_OK != ftStatus)
766  {
767  DEBUG_PRINT("Error requesting dev list from D2XX driver \n");
768  return RLS_RET_CODE_DEVICE_NOT_FOUND;
769  }
770 
771  pInfoList = (FT_DEVICE_LIST_INFO_NODE*) \
772  malloc(sizeof(FT_DEVICE_LIST_INFO_NODE) * numOfDevices) ;
773  if (NULL == pInfoList)
774  {
775  DEBUG_PRINT("malloc error during read device list\n");
776  return RLS_RET_CODE_MALLOC_FAILED;
777  }
778 
779  /* Get Device Information List */
780  ftStatus = FT_GetDeviceInfoList( pInfoList, &numOfDevices );
781  if (FT_OK != ftStatus)
782  {
783  DEBUG_PRINT("Error requesting dev list from D2XX driver \n");
784  free(pInfoList);
785  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_RD_ERROR;
786  }
787 
788  DEBUG_PRINT("rlsFindAndOpenDevice: Got %d devices connected \n",
789  numOfDevices);
790 
791  spiDevNumber = -1;
792  irqI2CDevNumber = -1;
793  boardControlDevNumber = -1;
794  genericGPIODevNumber = -1;
795  /* Search for SPI and IRQ device in the List */
796  for ( loopCounter=0; loopCounter < numOfDevices; loopCounter++ )
797  {
798  DEBUG_PRINT("Device %d: %s , SN: %s\n", loopCounter, \
799  pInfoList[loopCounter].Description, \
800  pInfoList[loopCounter].SerialNumber );
801  if (( memcmp( rls_spiDeviceName[pDevCtx->deviceIndex], \
802  pInfoList[loopCounter].Description, \
803  strlen(rls_spiDeviceName[pDevCtx->deviceIndex] )) == 0 ) || \
804  ( memcmp( rls_spiDeviceNameDevPack[pDevCtx->deviceIndex], \
805  pInfoList[loopCounter].Description, \
806  strlen(rls_spiDeviceNameDevPack[pDevCtx->deviceIndex] )) == 0 ))
807  {
808  /* Found SPI FTDI Device */
809  if(( pInfoList[loopCounter].Flags & FT_FLAGS_OPENED) == 0 )
810  {
811  spiDevNumber = loopCounter;
812  }
813  }
814 
815  if (( memcmp(rls_irqI2CDeviceName[pDevCtx->deviceIndex], \
816  pInfoList[loopCounter].Description, \
817  strlen(rls_irqI2CDeviceName[pDevCtx->deviceIndex]) ) == 0 ) || \
818  ( memcmp(rls_irqI2CDeviceNameDevPack[pDevCtx->deviceIndex], \
819  pInfoList[loopCounter].Description, \
820  strlen(rls_irqI2CDeviceNameDevPack[pDevCtx->deviceIndex] )) == 0))
821  {
822  /* Found IRQ-GPIO FTDI Device */
823  if((pInfoList[loopCounter].Flags & FT_FLAGS_OPENED) == 0)
824  {
825  irqI2CDevNumber = loopCounter;
826  }
827  }
828  if (( memcmp(rls_BoardControlDeviceName[pDevCtx->deviceIndex], \
829  pInfoList[loopCounter].Description, \
830  strlen(rls_BoardControlDeviceName[pDevCtx->deviceIndex]) ) == 0) || \
831  ( memcmp(rls_BoardControlDeviceNameDevPack[pDevCtx->deviceIndex], \
832  pInfoList[loopCounter].Description, \
833  strlen(rls_BoardControlDeviceNameDevPack[pDevCtx->deviceIndex]) ) == 0))
834  {
835  /* Found Board Control FTDI Device */
836  if((pInfoList[loopCounter].Flags & FT_FLAGS_OPENED) == 0)
837  {
838  boardControlDevNumber = loopCounter;
839  }
840  }
841 
842  if (( memcmp(rls_GenericGPIODeviceName[pDevCtx->deviceIndex], pInfoList[loopCounter].Description, \
843  strlen(rls_GenericGPIODeviceName[pDevCtx->deviceIndex]) ) == 0) ||
844  ( memcmp(rls_GenericGPIODeviceNameDevPack[pDevCtx->deviceIndex], pInfoList[loopCounter].Description, \
845  strlen(rls_GenericGPIODeviceNameDevPack[pDevCtx->deviceIndex]) ) == 0))
846  {
847  /* Found Generic GPIO FTDI Device */
848  if((pInfoList[loopCounter].Flags & FT_FLAGS_OPENED) == 0)
849  {
850  genericGPIODevNumber = loopCounter;
851  }
852  }
853  }
854 
855  free(pInfoList);
856 
857  /* Ignoring the BoardControl port as it is used for RS232 interface for some boards*/
858  if((-1 == spiDevNumber) || (-1 == irqI2CDevNumber) ||
859  /*(-1 == boardControlDevNumber) || */ (-1 == genericGPIODevNumber))
860  {
861  DEBUG_PRINT("Not all device USB ports were found (Spi=%d, Irq & I2C=%d,\
862  Board Control=%d, Generic GPIO=%d)\n", spiDevNumber,\
863  irqI2CDevNumber, boardControlDevNumber, genericGPIODevNumber);
864  return RLS_RET_CODE_DEVICE_NOT_FOUND;
865  }
866  else
867  {
868  if(!pDevCtx->spiHandle)
869  {
870  /* Open SPI Device */
871  ftStatus = FT_Open( spiDevNumber, &pDevCtx->spiHandle );
872  if (ftStatus != FT_OK)
873  {
874  DEBUG_PRINT("SPI port open error\n");
875  pDevCtx->spiHandle = 0;
876  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_OPEN_ERROR;
877  }
878  DEBUG_PRINT("SPI port opened (DeviceNum=%d)\n", spiDevNumber);
879  }
880 
881  if(!pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle)
882  {
883  /* Open IRQ & I2C Device */
884  ftStatus = FT_Open(irqI2CDevNumber, &pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle);
885  if (ftStatus != FT_OK)
886  {
887  DEBUG_PRINT("IRQ port open error\n");
888  pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle = 0;
889  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_OPEN_ERROR;
890  }
891  DEBUG_PRINT("IRQ & I2C port opened (DeviceNum=%d)\n",
892  irqI2CDevNumber);
893  }
894 #if 0
895  /* Disabled as some boards are using this port for RS232 interface*/
896  if(!pDevCtx->boardControlHandle)
897  {
898  /* Open Board Control Device */
899  ftStatus = FT_Open( boardControlDevNumber,
900  &pDevCtx->boardControlHandle );
901  if (ftStatus != FT_OK)
902  {
903  DEBUG_PRINT("Board Control port open error\n");
904  pDevCtx->boardControlHandle = 0;
905  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_OPEN_ERROR;
906  }
907  DEBUG_PRINT("Board Control port opened (DeviceNum=%d)\n",
908  boardControlDevNumber);
909  }
910 
911  if(!pDevCtx->genericGPIOHandle)
912  {
913  /* Open Generic GPIO Device */
914  ftStatus = FT_Open( genericGPIODevNumber,
915  &pDevCtx->genericGPIOHandle );
916  if (ftStatus != FT_OK)
917  {
918  DEBUG_PRINT("Generic GPIO port open error\n");
919  pDevCtx->genericGPIOHandle = 0;
920  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_OPEN_ERROR;
921  }
922  DEBUG_PRINT("Generic GPIO port opened (DeviceNum=%d)\n",
923  genericGPIODevNumber);
924  }
925 #endif
926  return RLS_RET_CODE_OK;
927  }
928 }
929 
930 static int rlsCloseDevice( rlsDevCtx_t* pDevCtx )
931 {
932  int error = RLS_RET_CODE_OK;
933  unsigned char Continue = 0;
934  FT_HANDLE irqI2cHandle_t = 0;
935  FT_HANDLE spiHandle_t = 0;
936  FT_HANDLE boardControlHandle_t = 0;
937  FT_HANDLE genericGPIOHandle_t = 0;
938 
939  if(pDevCtx == NULL)
940  {
941  return RLS_RET_CODE_NULL_PTR_ERROR;
942  }
943 
944  /* Close SPI Device */
945  if (0 != pDevCtx->spiHandle)
946  {
947  FT_Close( pDevCtx->spiHandle );
948  pDevCtx->spiHandle = 0;
949  }
950 
951  /* Close IRQ & I2C Device */
952  if (0 != pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle)
953  {
954  FT_Close( pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle );
955  pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle = 0;
956  }
957 
958  /* Close Board Control Device */
959  if (0 != pDevCtx->boardControlHandle)
960  {
961  FT_Close( pDevCtx->boardControlHandle );
962  pDevCtx->boardControlHandle = 0;
963  }
964 
965  /* Close Generic GPIO Device */
966  if (0 != pDevCtx->genericGPIOHandle)
967  {
968  FT_Close( pDevCtx->genericGPIOHandle );
969  pDevCtx->genericGPIOHandle = 0;
970  }
971 
972  return RLS_RET_CODE_OK;
973 }
974 
975 static rlsDevCtx_t* rlsInitDeviceCtx( unsigned char deviceIndex )
976 {
977  rlsDevCtx_t* pDevCtx = NULL;
978 
979  if( deviceIndex < RLS_NUM_CONNECTED_DEVICES_MAX )
980  {
981  pDevCtx = &(rls_devCtx[deviceIndex]);
982  if (NULL == rls_gIrqI2cMutex)
983  {
984  rls_gIrqI2cMutex = CreateMutex( NULL, // default security attributes
985  FALSE, // initially not owned
986  NULL); // unnamed mutex
987  }
988 
989  pDevCtx->deviceIndex = deviceIndex ; /*adding right device index for device context*/
990  pDevCtx->deviceEnabled = FALSE;
991  pDevCtx->irqMasked = FALSE;
992  pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle = 0;
993  pDevCtx->spiHandle = 0;
994 
995  pDevCtx->hostIntrThread.threadHdl = 0;
996  pDevCtx->hostIntrThread.threadID = 0;
997  pDevCtx->hostIntrThread.handler = 0;
998  pDevCtx->hostIntrThread.pValue = 0;
999  InitializeCriticalSection( &(pDevCtx->cs) );
1000  }
1001 
1002  return pDevCtx;
1003 }
1004 
1005 static int rlsClearDeviceCtx(rlsDevCtx_t* pDevCtx)
1006 {
1007  int retVal = RLS_RET_CODE_NULL_PTR_ERROR;
1008 
1009  if(pDevCtx != NULL)
1010  {
1011  /* Delete Critical Section */
1012  DeleteCriticalSection( &(pDevCtx->cs) );
1013  CloseHandle(rls_gIrqI2cMutex);
1014 
1015  /* Clear device context */
1016  pDevCtx->deviceEnabled = FALSE;
1017  retVal = RLS_RET_CODE_OK;
1018  }
1019 
1020  return retVal;
1021 }
1022 
1023 static int rlsCheckForIrq(rlsDevCtx_t* pDevCtx , int level)
1024 {
1025  unsigned char inputBuffer[16] = {0};
1026  unsigned char outputBuffer[16] = {0};
1027  FT_STATUS ftStatus = FT_OK;
1028  DWORD BytesTransfer = 0;
1029  DWORD BytesTransfered = 0;
1030  DWORD BytesToRead = 0;
1031  DWORD BytesRead = 0;
1032  int hostIntRecv = 0;
1033 
1034  BytesTransfer = 0 ; // command to read its state
1035  outputBuffer[BytesTransfer++] = 0x81;
1036  ftStatus = FT_Write( pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle, outputBuffer, BytesTransfer,
1037  &BytesTransfered );
1038  do
1039  {
1040  ftStatus = FT_GetQueueStatus( pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle, &BytesToRead );
1041  } while((BytesToRead == 0) && ftStatus == FT_OK);
1042  ftStatus |= FT_Read( pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle, inputBuffer, BytesToRead,
1043  &BytesRead );
1044  if ((ftStatus != FT_OK))
1045  {
1046  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_RD_ERROR;
1047  }
1048 
1049  if( ((inputBuffer[0] & (1<<5)) != 0 ) && (pDevCtx->deviceEnabled == TRUE ))
1050  {
1051  hostIntRecv = (inputBuffer[0] >> 5) & 0x1;
1052  }
1053 
1054  if (hostIntRecv == level)
1055  {
1056  DEBUG_PRINT("Device [%d] Host IRQ High\r\n",
1057  pDevCtx->deviceIndex);
1058 
1059  return RLS_RET_CODE_OK;
1060  }
1061  else
1062  {
1063  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_TIMEOUT;
1064  }
1065 }
1066 
1067 static DWORD WINAPI rlsPollingThreadEntrySpi( LPVOID pParam )
1068 {
1069  rlsDevCtx_t* pDevCtx = (rlsDevCtx_t*)pParam;
1070  int checkIrqRes = 0;
1071 
1072  rls_hostIntrThreadLoop = 1;
1073  rls_hostIntrExitThread = 1;
1074  rls_numOfRunningSPIThreads++;
1075 
1076  while( rls_hostIntrThreadLoop )
1077  {
1078  if ( (!pDevCtx->deviceEnabled) || (pDevCtx->irqMasked))
1079  {
1080  Sleep(1);
1081  /* Added this one for letting WIN7 yield for the next thread.
1082  In case we don't have it - the do/while loop will not yield and
1083  we will delay other threads by waiting for this thread */
1084  SwitchToThread();
1085  continue;
1086  }
1087 
1088  if (0 == WaitForSingleObject(rls_gIrqI2cMutex, 1000))
1089  {
1090  /* check for Host IRQ */
1091  checkIrqRes = rlsCheckForIrq(pDevCtx, 1);
1092 
1093  ReleaseMutex(rls_gIrqI2cMutex);
1094  }
1095 
1096  /* Check if Device is Enabled, IRQ is received and is not in masked State */
1097  if ((!pDevCtx->deviceEnabled) || (0 != checkIrqRes) || \
1098  (pDevCtx->irqMasked))
1099  {
1100  Sleep(1);
1101  /* Added this one for letting WIN7 yield for the next thread.
1102  In case we don't have it - the do/while loop will not yield and
1103  we will delay other threads by waiting for this thread */
1104  SwitchToThread();
1105  continue;
1106  }
1107 
1108  /* Check if Interrupt handler is registered */
1109  if (pDevCtx->hostIntrThread.handler)
1110  {
1111  pDevCtx->hostIntrThread.handler(pDevCtx->deviceIndex,
1112  (rlsDevHandle_t)pDevCtx);
1113  }
1114 
1115  if (rls_numOfRunningSPIThreads > 1)
1116  {
1117  rls_numOfRunningSPIThreads--;
1118  pDevCtx->hostIntrThread.threadHdl = NULL;
1119  return RLS_RET_CODE_OK;
1120  }
1121  }
1122  rls_hostIntrExitThread = 0;
1123  rls_numOfRunningSPIThreads--;
1124  return RLS_RET_CODE_OK;
1125 }
1126 
1127 static int rlsStartIrqPollingThread( rlsDevCtx_t* pDevCtx )
1128 {
1129  int error = RLS_RET_CODE_OK;
1130  DWORD currThread = GetCurrentThreadId();
1131 
1132  rls_hostIntrThreadLoop = 0;
1133 
1134 
1135  if (0 == pDevCtx->hostIntrThread.threadHdl)
1136  {
1137  /* Create Host IRQ Polling Thread */
1138  pDevCtx->hostIntrThread.threadHdl = CreateThread(NULL, 0,
1139  rlsPollingThreadEntrySpi, pDevCtx, 0,
1140  &pDevCtx->hostIntrThread.threadID);
1141  }
1142  else
1143  {
1144  rlsLockDevice(pDevCtx);
1145  if( pDevCtx->hostIntrThread.threadID != currThread )
1146  {
1147  TerminateThread( pDevCtx->hostIntrThread.threadHdl,0 );
1148  Sleep(200);
1149  }
1150 
1151  pDevCtx->hostIntrThread.threadHdl = CreateThread( NULL, 0,
1152  rlsPollingThreadEntrySpi, pDevCtx, 0,
1153  &pDevCtx->hostIntrThread.threadID );
1154  rlsUnlockDevice(pDevCtx);
1155  }
1156 
1157  /* wait for the thread to start */
1158  while(rls_hostIntrThreadLoop == 0)
1159  {
1160  Sleep(1);
1161  }
1162 
1163  return RLS_RET_CODE_OK;
1164 }
1165 
1166 static int rlsStopIrqPollingThread( rlsDevCtx_t* pDevCtx )
1167 {
1168  int error = RLS_RET_CODE_OK;
1169  DWORD currThread = GetCurrentThreadId();
1170 
1171  rls_hostIntrThreadLoop = 0;
1172 
1173  if( pDevCtx->hostIntrThread.threadHdl && (pDevCtx->hostIntrThread.threadID \
1174  != currThread ))
1175  {
1176  /* Wait for polling thread to terminate */
1177  while(rls_hostIntrExitThread == 1)
1178  {
1179  Sleep(1);
1180  }
1181  }
1182  else
1183  {
1184  DEBUG_PRINT("Stopping RL IRQ polling thread \n");
1185  }
1186  pDevCtx->hostIntrThread.threadHdl = NULL;
1187 
1188  return RLS_RET_CODE_OK;
1189 }
1190 
1203 static void rlsHighSpeedSetI2CStart( BYTE *pI2cBuffer,
1204  DWORD *pI2cBytesToTransfer )
1205 {
1206  DWORD dwCount;
1207 
1208  for(dwCount=0; dwCount < 4; dwCount++) /* Repeat commands to ensure the min period of start
1209  hold time ie 600ns is achieved*/
1210  {
1211  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = '\x80' ; /*Set directions of lower 8 pins and force
1212  value on bits set as output*/
1213  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = (0x03 | PMIC_MASK) ; /*Set SDA, SCL high and Read Modify Write of Mux Control Pin*/ //4cascade
1214  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = RLS_PORTB_CONFIG ; /*Set SK,DO as o/p and DI as i/p*/
1215  }
1216 
1217  for(dwCount=0; dwCount < 4; dwCount++) /* Repeat commands to ensure the min period of start
1218  setup time ie 600ns is achieved*/
1219  {
1220  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = '\x80' ; /*Set directions of lower 8 pins and force
1221  value on bits set as output*/
1222  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = (0x01 | PMIC_MASK) ; /*Set SDA low, SCL high and Read Modify Write of Mux Control Pin*/ //4cascade
1223  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = RLS_PORTB_CONFIG ; /*Set SK,DO as o/p and DI as i/p*/
1224  }
1225 
1226  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = '\x80' ; /*Set directions of lower 8 pins and force
1227  value on bits set as output*/
1228  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = (0x00 | PMIC_MASK) ; /*Set SDA, SCL low and Read Modify Write of Mux Control Pin*/ //4cascade
1229  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = RLS_PORTB_CONFIG ; /*Set SK,DO as o/p and DI as i/p */
1230 }
1231 
1243 static void rlsHighSpeedSetI2CStop( BYTE *pI2cBuffer,
1244  DWORD *pI2cBytesToTransfer )
1245 {
1246  DWORD dwCount;
1247  for(dwCount=0; dwCount<4; dwCount++) /* Repeat commands to ensure the min period of stop
1248  setup time ie 600ns is achieved*/
1249  {
1250  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = '\x80' ; /*Set directions of lower 8 pins and force
1251  value on bits set as output*/
1252  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = (0x01| PMIC_MASK) ; /*Set SDA low, SCL high and Read Modify Write of Mux Control Pin*/ //4cascade
1253  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = RLS_PORTB_CONFIG ; /*Set SK,DO as o/p and DI as i/p*/
1254  }
1255 
1256  for(dwCount=0; dwCount<4; dwCount++) /* Repeat commands to ensure the min period of stop
1257  hold time ie 600ns is achieved*/
1258  {
1259  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = '\x80' ; /*Set directions of lower 8 pins and force
1260  value on bits set as output*/
1261  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = (0x03 | PMIC_MASK) ; /*Set SDA, SCL high and Read Modify Write of Mux Control Pin*/ //4cascade
1262  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = RLS_PORTB_CONFIG ; /*Set SK,DO as o/p and DI as i/p*/
1263  }
1264 
1265 }
1266 
1282 static int rlsI2CSendByteAndCheckACK( FT_HANDLE ftHandle, BYTE *pI2cBuffer,
1283  DWORD *pI2cBytesToTransfer,
1284  DWORD *pI2cBytesTransfered,
1285  BYTE dwDataSend )
1286 {
1287  FT_STATUS ftStatus = FT_OK;
1288 
1289  /*Clock data byte out on �ve Clock Edge MSB first*/
1290  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = RLS_MSB_FALLING_EDGE_CLOCK_BYTE_OUT;
1291  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = '\x00';
1292  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = '\x00' ; /*Data length of 0x0000 means 1 byte data to clock out*/
1293  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = dwDataSend ; /*Add data to be send*/
1294 
1295  /* Get Acknowledge bit from I2C slave */
1296  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = '\x80' ; /*Command to set directions of lower 8 pins and
1297  force value on bits set as output*/
1298  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = (0x00 | PMIC_MASK) ; /*Set SCL low and Read Modify Write of Mux Control Pin*/ //4cascade
1299  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = RLS_PORTB_CONFIG & 0xFD ; /*Set SK as output and DO as input*/
1300 
1301  /*Command to scan in ACK bit , -ve clock Edge MSB first */
1302  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = RLS_MSB_RISING_EDGE_CLOCK_BIT_IN ;
1303  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = '\x0' ; /*Length of 0x0 means to scan in 1 bit*/
1304  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = '\x87' ; /*Send answer back immediate command*/
1305 
1306  /*Send off the commands*/
1307  ftStatus = FT_Write( ftHandle, pI2cBuffer, (*pI2cBytesToTransfer),
1308  pI2cBytesTransfered ) ;
1309  (*pI2cBytesToTransfer) = 0 ; /*Clear output buffer*/
1310 
1311  /*Check if ACK bit received, may need to read more times to get ACK bit or fail if timeout*/
1312  ftStatus = FT_Read( ftHandle, pI2cBuffer, 1, pI2cBytesTransfered ) ; /*Read one byte from device
1313  receive buffer*/
1314  if( (ftStatus != FT_OK) || (*pI2cBytesTransfered == 0) )
1315  {
1316  return FALSE ; /*Error, can't get the ACK bit from I2C slave */
1317  }
1318  else
1319  if ( (pI2cBuffer[0] & '\x1') != '\x0' ) /*Check ACK bit 0 on data byte read out*/
1320  {
1321  (*pI2cBytesToTransfer) = 0;
1322  return FALSE ; /*Error, can't get the ACK bit from I2C slave */
1323  }
1324 
1325  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = '\x80' ; /*Command to set directions of lower 8 pins and
1326  force value on bits set as output*/
1327  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = (0x02 | PMIC_MASK) ; /*Set SDA high, SCL low and Read Modify Write of Mux Control Pin*/ //4cascade
1328  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = RLS_PORTB_CONFIG ; /*Set SK,DO as output and DI as input*/
1329  return TRUE;
1330 }
1331 
1349 static int rlsI2CReadByteAndSendNACK( FT_HANDLE ftHandle, BYTE *pI2cBuffer,
1350  DWORD *pI2cBytesToTransfer,
1351  DWORD *pI2cBytesTransfered, BYTE *Data )
1352 {
1353  int ftStatus, readTimeoutCounter;
1354  DWORD i2cNumInputBuffer;
1355  BYTE inputBuffer[10];
1356 
1357  /* Clock one byte of data in...*/
1358  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = 0x20 ; /*Command: clock data byte in on clk rising edge*/
1359  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = 0x00 ; /* Length*/
1360  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = 0x00 ; /* Length 0x0000 means clock ONE byte in*/
1361 
1362  /*Now clock out one bit (ACK/NAK). This bit has value '1' to send a NAK to the I2C Slave*/
1363  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = 0x13 ; /*Command: clock data bits out on clk falling edge*/
1364  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = 0x00 ; /*Length of 0x00 means clock out ONE bit*/
1365  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = 0xFF ; /*Command will send bit 7 of this byte (= �1�)*/
1366 
1367  /* Put I2C line back to idle (during transfer) state... Clock line low, Data line high*/
1368  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = 0x80 ; /* Command to set ADbus direction/ data*/
1369  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = (0xFE | PMIC_MASK) ; /* Set the value of the pins and Read Modify Write of Mux Control Pin*/ //4cascade
1370  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = RLS_PORTB_CONFIG & 0xFB ; /* Set pins o/p except bit 2 (DI)*/
1371  /* B0 (SCL) is output driven low
1372  B1 (DATA OUT) is output high (open drain)
1373  B2 (DATA IN) is input (therefore the output value specified is ignored)*/
1374 
1375  /* This command then tells the MPSSE to send any results gathered back immediately*/
1376  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = 0x87 ; /* Send answer back immediate command*/
1377 
1378  /* Send off the commands to the FT4232H*/
1379  ftStatus = FT_Write( ftHandle, pI2cBuffer, *pI2cBytesToTransfer,
1380  pI2cBytesTransfered );
1381  (*pI2cBytesToTransfer) = 0 ; /*Clear output buffer*/
1382 
1383  /* Now wait for the byte which we read to come back to the host PC*/
1384  i2cNumInputBuffer = 0;
1385  readTimeoutCounter = 0;
1386  ftStatus = FT_GetQueueStatus( ftHandle, &i2cNumInputBuffer );
1387 
1388  /* Get number of bytes in the input buffer*/
1389  while((i2cNumInputBuffer < 1) && (ftStatus == FT_OK) && \
1390  (readTimeoutCounter < 500))
1391  {
1392  /* Sit in this loop until
1393  (1) we receive the one byte expected
1394  or (2) a hardware error occurs causing the GetQueueStatus to return an error code
1395  or (3) we have checked 500 times and the expected byte is not coming*/
1396  ftStatus = FT_GetQueueStatus( ftHandle, &i2cNumInputBuffer ) ; /* Get # bytes in buffer*/
1397  readTimeoutCounter++;
1398  Sleep(1) ; // short delay
1399  }
1400  /* If loop above exited due to the byte coming back (not an error code and not a timeout)
1401  then read the byte available and return True to indicate success*/
1402  if ((ftStatus == FT_OK) && (readTimeoutCounter < 500))
1403  {
1404  ftStatus = FT_Read( ftHandle, &inputBuffer, i2cNumInputBuffer,
1405  pI2cBytesTransfered);
1406  *Data = inputBuffer[0] ; /* store the data read*/
1407  return TRUE ; /* Indicate success */
1408  }
1409  else
1410  {
1411  return FALSE ; /* Failed to get any data back or got an error code back*/
1412  }
1413 }
1414 
1432 static int rlsI2CReadByteAndSendACK( FT_HANDLE ftHandle, BYTE *pI2cBuffer,
1433  DWORD *pI2cBytesToTransfer,
1434  DWORD *pI2cBytesTransfered, BYTE *Data )
1435 {
1436  int ftStatus, readTimeoutCounter;
1437  DWORD i2cNumInputBuffer;
1438  BYTE inputBuffer[10];
1439 
1440  /* Clock one byte of data in...*/
1441  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = 0x20 ; /*Command: clock data byte in on clk rising edge*/
1442  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = 0x00 ; /* Length*/
1443  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = 0x00 ; /* Length 0x0000 means clock ONE byte in*/
1444 
1445  /*Now clock out one bit (ACK/NAK). This bit has value '1' to send a NAK to the I2C Slave*/
1446  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = 0x13 ; /*Command: clock data bits out on clk falling
1447  edge*/
1448  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = 0x00 ; /*Length of 0x00 means clock out ONE bit*/
1449  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = 0x00 ; /*Command will send bit 7 of this byte (= �1�)*/
1450 
1451  /*Put I2C line back to idle (during transfer) state... Clock line low, Data line high*/
1452  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = 0x80 ; /*Command to set ADbus direction/ data*/
1453  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = (0xFE | PMIC_MASK) ; /*Set the value of the pins and Read Modify Write of Mux Control Pin*/ //4cascade
1454  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = RLS_PORTB_CONFIG & 0xFB ; /*Set pins o/p except bit 2 (DI)*/
1455  /* B0 (SCL) is output driven low
1456  B1 (DATA OUT) is output high (open drain)
1457  B2 (DATA IN) is input (therefore the output value specified is ignored)*/
1458 
1459  /* This command then tells the MPSSE to send any results gathered back immediately */
1460  pI2cBuffer[(*pI2cBytesToTransfer)++] = 0x87 ; /* Send answer back immediate command */
1461 
1462  /* Send off the commands to the FT4232H */
1463  ftStatus = FT_Write( ftHandle, pI2cBuffer, *pI2cBytesToTransfer,
1464  pI2cBytesTransfered );
1465  (*pI2cBytesToTransfer) = 0 ; /*Clear output buffer*/
1466 
1467  /* Now wait for the byte which we read to come back to the host PC*/
1468  i2cNumInputBuffer = 0;
1469  readTimeoutCounter = 0;
1470  ftStatus = FT_GetQueueStatus( ftHandle, &i2cNumInputBuffer );
1471 
1472  /* Get number of bytes in the input buffer*/
1473  while( (i2cNumInputBuffer < 1) && (ftStatus == FT_OK) && \
1474  (readTimeoutCounter < 500) )
1475  {
1476  /* Sit in this loop until
1477  (1) we receive the one byte expected
1478  or (2) a hardware error occurs causing the GetQueueStatus to return an error code
1479  or (3) we have checked 500 times and the expected byte is not coming*/
1480  ftStatus = FT_GetQueueStatus( ftHandle, &i2cNumInputBuffer ) ; /*Get # bytes in buffer*/
1481  readTimeoutCounter++;
1482  Sleep(1) ; /*short delay*/
1483  }
1484 
1485  /* If loop above exited due to the byte coming back (not an error code and not a timeout)
1486  then read the byte available and return True to indicate success*/
1487  if( (ftStatus == FT_OK) && (readTimeoutCounter < 500) )
1488  {
1489  ftStatus = FT_Read( ftHandle, &inputBuffer, i2cNumInputBuffer,
1490  pI2cBytesTransfered );
1491  *Data = inputBuffer[0] ; /* store the data read */
1492  return TRUE ; /* Indicate success */
1493  }
1494  else
1495  {
1496  return FALSE ; /* Failed to get any data back or got an error code back */
1497  }
1498 }

1508 int rlsDisableDevice( unsigned char deviceIndex )
1509 {
1510  rlsDevCtx_t* pDevCtx;
1511 
1512  DEBUG_PRINT("Disable Device\n");
1513 
1514 #ifndef RLS_SPI_SIMULATION
1515  pDevCtx = (rlsDevCtx_t *)rlsGetDeviceCtx(deviceIndex);
1516  if(NULL != pDevCtx)
1517  {
1518  pDevCtx->deviceEnabled = FALSE;
1519 
1520  if(pDevCtx->hostIntrThread.threadHdl != NULL)
1521  {
1522  rlsStopIrqPollingThread(pDevCtx);
1523  pDevCtx->hostIntrThread.threadHdl = NULL;
1524  }
1525  }
1526  else
1527  {
1528  return RLS_RET_CODE_NULL_PTR_ERROR;
1529  }
1530 
1531 #endif
1532 
1533  return RLS_RET_CODE_OK;
1534 }

1544 int rlsEnableDevice( unsigned char deviceIndex )
1545 {
1546  rlsDevCtx_t* pDevCtx;
1547  int retVal = RLS_RET_CODE_OK;
1548 
1549  DEBUG_PRINT("Enable Device\n");
1550 
1551 #ifndef RLS_SPI_SIMULATION
1552  pDevCtx = (rlsDevCtx_t *)rlsGetDeviceCtx(deviceIndex);
1553 
1554  if(NULL != pDevCtx)
1555  {
1556  pDevCtx->deviceEnabled = TRUE;
1557  /* Starting Interrupt Thread after Power on to avoid Spurious Interrupt */
1558  if (NULL != pDevCtx->hostIntrThread.handler)
1559  {
1560  rlsStartIrqPollingThread(pDevCtx);
1561  }
1562  }
1563  else
1564  {
1565  retVal = RLS_RET_CODE_NULL_PTR_ERROR;
1566  }
1567 #endif
1568  return retVal;
1569 }

1587 int rlsRegisterInterruptHandler( unsigned char deviceIndex,
1588  RLS_P_EVENT_HANDLER fpInterruptHdl ,
1589  void* pValue )
1590 {
1591  rlsDevCtx_t* pDevCtx;
1592 
1593  pDevCtx = (rlsDevCtx_t *)rlsGetDeviceCtx(deviceIndex);
1594 
1595  if(NULL != pDevCtx)
1596  {
1597  rlsLockDevice(pDevCtx);
1598  pDevCtx->hostIntrThread.handler = fpInterruptHdl;
1599  pDevCtx->hostIntrThread.pValue = pValue;
1600  rlsUnlockDevice(pDevCtx);
1601  if(pDevCtx->hostIntrThread.threadHdl != NULL)
1602  {
1603  rlsStopIrqPollingThread(pDevCtx);
1604  pDevCtx->hostIntrThread.threadHdl = NULL;
1605  }
1606  return RLS_RET_CODE_OK;
1607  }
1608  else
1609  {
1610  return RLS_RET_CODE_NULL_PTR_ERROR;
1611  }
1612 }

1659 int rlsDeviceWaitIrqStatus( rlsDevHandle_t hdl, unsigned char level )
1660 {
1661  rlsDevCtx_t* pDevCtx = (rlsDevCtx_t*)hdl;
1662  unsigned char inputBuffer[16] = { 0 };
1663  unsigned char outputBuffer[16] = { 0 };
1664  FT_STATUS ftStatus = FT_OK;
1665  DWORD BytesTransfer = 0;
1666  DWORD BytesTransfered = 0;
1667  DWORD BytesToRead = 0;
1668  DWORD BytesRead = 0;
1669  int hostIntRecv = 0;
1670 
1671  WaitForSingleObject(rls_gIrqI2cMutex, INFINITE);
1672  do
1673  {
1674  BytesTransfer = 0;
1675 
1676  /* Read Board Control Port(C)*/
1677  outputBuffer[BytesTransfer++] = 0x81;
1678  ftStatus = FT_Write( pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle, outputBuffer, BytesTransfer,
1679  &BytesTransfered );
1680 
1681  Sleep(2);
1682 
1683  ftStatus |= FT_GetQueueStatus( pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle, &BytesToRead );
1684 
1685  ftStatus |= FT_Read( pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle, inputBuffer, BytesToRead,
1686  &BytesRead );
1687 
1688  if ((ftStatus != FT_OK))
1689  {
1690  break;
1691  }
1692  else
1693  {
1694  hostIntRecv = inputBuffer[0] & (1 << 5);
1695  }
1696 
1697  if (hostIntRecv == level)
1698  {
1699  DEBUG_PRINT("Device [%d] Host IRQ Low\r\n", pDevCtx->deviceIndex);
1700  ReleaseMutex(rls_gIrqI2cMutex);
1701  return RLS_RET_CODE_OK;
1702  }
1703  } while( level != hostIntRecv );
1704  ReleaseMutex(rls_gIrqI2cMutex);
1705  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_RD_ERROR;
1706 }
1707 
1720 rlsDevHandle_t rlsCommOpen(unsigned char deviceIndex, unsigned int flags )
1721 {
1722  rlsDevCtx_t* pDevCtx;
1723  BOOLEAN InitOk = TRUE;
1724 
1725  pDevCtx = rlsInitDeviceCtx( deviceIndex );
1726 
1727  if( NULL != pDevCtx )
1728  {
1729  IGNORE_WARNING_UNUSED_VAR( flags );
1730  DEBUG_PRINT("[VER] mmWaveLink Studio Version: %s\r\n", RL_STUDIO_VER);
1731 
1732  /* Find and Open SPI/IRQ device */
1733  if (0 != rlsFindAndOpenDevice(pDevCtx))
1734  {
1735  InitOk = FALSE;
1736  DEBUG_PRINT("could not open device\r\n");
1737  }
1738 
1739  /* Initialize SPI device */
1740  if (0 != rlsInitSpiPort(pDevCtx))
1741  {
1742  InitOk = FALSE;
1743  DEBUG_PRINT("could not open spi port\r\n");
1744  }
1745 
1746  /* Initialize IRQ device */
1747  if (0 != rlsInitIrqI2CPort(pDevCtx))
1748  {
1749  InitOk = FALSE;
1750  DEBUG_PRINT("could not open irq port\r\n");
1751  }
1752 
1753  /* Initialize Board Control device */
1754  if (0 != rlsInitBoardControlPort(pDevCtx))
1755  {
1756  InitOk = FALSE;
1757  DEBUG_PRINT("could not open Board Control port\r\n");
1758  }
1759 
1760  /* Initialize Generic GPIO device */
1761  if (0 != rlsInitGenericGPIOPort(pDevCtx))
1762  {
1763  InitOk = FALSE;
1764  DEBUG_PRINT("could not open GPIO port\r\n");
1765  }
1766 
1767  /* Check for Errors, Return */
1768  if(!InitOk)
1769  {
1770  rlsClearDeviceCtx(pDevCtx);
1771  return NULL;
1772  }
1773  else
1774  {
1775  DEBUG_PRINT("FTDI Open Successful\n");
1776  /* FTDI Open Successful, Return Handle */
1777  return (rlsDevHandle_t) pDevCtx;
1778  }
1779  }
1780 
1781  return NULL;
1782 }
1783 
1791 int rlsCommClose( rlsDevHandle_t hdl )
1792 {
1793  rlsDevCtx_t* pDevCtx = (rlsDevCtx_t*) hdl;
1794 
1795  /* Close FTDI Device */
1796  rlsCloseDevice(pDevCtx) ;
1797  return RLS_RET_CODE_OK;
1798 }
1799 
1812 int rlsSpiRead( rlsDevHandle_t hdl, unsigned char *preadbuffer,
1813  unsigned short ReadLength )
1814 {
1815 #define COMMAND_LENGTH 10
1816  rlsDevCtx_t* pDevCtx = (rlsDevCtx_t*)hdl;
1817  int retVal = 0;
1818  int spiWordSize = 2;
1819  DWORD bytesSent = 0;
1820  int bytesReceived = 0;
1821  int dataAvailable = 0;
1822  char buffer[COMMAND_LENGTH];
1823  DWORD tempByteRecv = 0;
1824  FT_STATUS status = FT_OK;
1825  unsigned int i = 0;
1826  unsigned int timeoutCnt = 0;
1827  unsigned char tempData = 0;
1828 
1829  /* Read Remaining Length from device */
1830  rlsLockDevice(pDevCtx);
1831 
1832  for (i = 0; i < ReadLength; i += spiWordSize)
1833  {
1834  buffer[0] = 0x80; /* Set Data bits LowByte */
1835  buffer[1] = 0xC2; /* Set CS Low, MOSI high */
1836  buffer[2] = RLS_PORTA_CONFIG; /* Set Pin Direction */
1837 
1838  if (rls_spiPhase == 0)
1839  {
1840  buffer[3] = 0x20; /* Read bytes on +ve (posedge), MSB first, no write */
1841  }
1842  else
1843  {
1844  buffer[3] = 0x24; /* Read bytes on -ve (negedge), MSB first, no write */
1845  }
1846 
1847  buffer[4] = (unsigned char)((spiWordSize - 1) & 0xFF); /* Set Length LSB */
1848 
1849  buffer[5] = (unsigned char)(((spiWordSize - 1) >> 8) & 0xFF); /* Set Length MSB */
1850 
1851  buffer[6] = 0x80; /* Set Data bits LowByte */
1852  buffer[7] = 0xC8; /* Set CS High, MOSI Low */
1853  buffer[8] = RLS_PORTA_CONFIG; /* Set Pin Direction */
1854  buffer[9] = 0x87; /* Send Immediate */
1855 
1856  /* Write to FTDI MPSSE */
1857  status = FT_Write(pDevCtx->spiHandle, &buffer[0], COMMAND_LENGTH,
1858  (LPDWORD)&bytesSent);
1859 
1860  if (FT_OK != status)
1861  {
1862  DEBUG_PRINT("Read error, couldn't send command to MSPEE \n");
1863  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_WR_ERROR;
1864  }
1865 
1866  do
1867  {
1868  /* Check if data is received */
1869  status = FT_GetQueueStatus(pDevCtx->spiHandle,
1870  (DWORD *)&dataAvailable);
1871  timeoutCnt++;
1872  } while ((FT_OK == status) && (dataAvailable < spiWordSize) &&
1873  (timeoutCnt < RLS_FTDI_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT));
1874 
1875  if (FT_OK != status)
1876  {
1877  DEBUG_PRINT("Wait Data Available Error\n");
1878  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_RD_ERROR;
1879  }
1880  /*
1881  else if (RLS_FTDI_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT == timeoutCnt)
1882  {
1883  DEBUG_PRINT("Time Out During SPI Read\n");
1884  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_TIMEOUT;
1885  }
1886  */
1887  /* Read from FTDI MPSSE */
1888  status = FT_Read(pDevCtx->spiHandle, (preadbuffer + i),
1889  (DWORD)spiWordSize, (LPDWORD)&tempByteRecv);
1890  tempData = *(preadbuffer + i);
1891  *(preadbuffer + i) = *(preadbuffer + i + 1);
1892  *(preadbuffer + i + 1) = tempData;
1893 
1894  bytesReceived += 2;
1895  }
1896  rlsUnlockDevice(pDevCtx);
1897 
1898  /* Create data buffer and print it into file */
1899  char tempBuff[2048] = {0};
1900  int offset = 0;
1901  for (i = 0; i < ReadLength; i += 2)
1902  {
1903  int j = 0;
1904  j = sprintf(&tempBuff[offset], "0x%02X%02X ", preadbuffer[i + 1],
1905  preadbuffer[i]);
1906  offset = offset + j;
1907  }
1908  sprintf(&tempBuff[offset], "\r\n");
1909  DEBUG_PRINT("Device [%d] [RD]%s", pDevCtx->deviceIndex, tempBuff);
1910 
1911  if ((FT_OK != status) || (bytesReceived != ReadLength))
1912  {
1913  DEBUG_PRINT("Read transfer error \n");
1914  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_RD_ERROR;
1915  }
1916 
1917  return (int)bytesReceived;
1918 }
1919 
1931 int rlsSpiWrite( rlsDevHandle_t hdl, unsigned char *pwriteBuffer,
1932  unsigned short WriteLength )
1933 {
1934  rlsDevCtx_t *pDevCtx = (rlsDevCtx_t*)hdl;
1935  char* pbuffer = NULL;
1936  char buffer[12];
1937  DWORD bytesSent = 0;
1938  DWORD tempBytesSent = 0;
1939  FT_STATUS status = FT_OK;
1940  unsigned short i = 0;
1941 
1942 #ifdef RLS_SPI_SIMULATION
1943 #else
1944 
1945  rlsLockDevice(pDevCtx);
1946 
1947  /* Set Data bits LowByte */
1948  buffer[0] = 0x80;
1949  /* Set CS low */
1950  buffer[1] = 0xC0;
1951  /* Set Pin Direction */
1952  buffer[2] = RLS_PORTA_CONFIG;
1953  if(rls_spiPhase == 0)
1954  {
1955  /* Read bytes on +ve (posedge), MSB first, no write */
1956  buffer[3] = 0x11;
1957  }
1958  else
1959  {
1960  /* Read bytes on -ve (negedge), MSB first, no write */
1961  buffer[3] = 0x10;
1962  }
1963  /*Clock bytes on -ve (negedge), MSB first, no read */
1964  buffer[3] = 0x11;
1965  /* Write Length MSB */
1966  buffer[4] = (unsigned char) ((1) & 0xFF);
1967  /* Write Length LSB */
1968  buffer[5] = (unsigned char) (((1)>>8) & 0xFF);
1969  //memcpy(&pbuffer[6], Bytebuffer+i, 2);
1970  /* Set Data bits LSB */
1971  buffer[2+6] = 0x80;
1972  /* Set CS High */
1973  buffer[2+7] = 0xC8;
1974  /* Set Pin Direction */
1975  buffer[2+8] = RLS_PORTA_CONFIG;
1976  /* Send Immediate */
1977  buffer[2+9] = 0x87;
1978 
1979  for(i =0; i< WriteLength; i+=2)
1980  {
1981  /* Write Data Bits */
1982  buffer[6] = *(pwriteBuffer+i+1);
1983  buffer[7] = *(pwriteBuffer+i);
1984 
1985  /* Write to FTDI MPSSE */
1986  status = FT_Write(pDevCtx->spiHandle,
1987  buffer,
1988  12,
1989  &tempBytesSent);
1990  bytesSent += tempBytesSent;
1991  }
1992  rlsUnlockDevice(pDevCtx);
1993 #endif
1994  /* Create data buffer and print it into file */
1995  char tempBuff[2048] = {0};
1996  int offset = 0;
1997  for (i = 0; i < WriteLength; i += 2)
1998  {
1999  int j = 0;
2000  j = sprintf(&tempBuff[offset], "0x%02X%02X ", pwriteBuffer[i + 1],
2001  pwriteBuffer[i]);
2002  offset = offset + j;
2003  }
2004  sprintf(&tempBuff[offset], "\r\n");
2005  DEBUG_PRINT("Device [%d] [WR]%s", pDevCtx->deviceIndex, tempBuff);
2006 
2007  if (status != FT_OK)
2008  {
2009  DEBUG_PRINT("MSPEE Write Command Error\n");
2010  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_WR_ERROR;
2011  }
2012  return (int)(WriteLength);
2013 }
2014 
2027 int rlsI2cRead( rlsDevHandle_t hdl, unsigned char *preadbuffer,
2028  unsigned short ReadLength )
2029 {
2030  rlsDevCtx_t* pDevCtx = (rlsDevCtx_t*)hdl;
2031  FT_STATUS ftStatus;
2032  int status = 0;
2033  unsigned char i = 0;
2034  BYTE i2cBuffer[100];
2035  DWORD i2cBytesToTransfer = 0;
2036  DWORD i2cBytesTransfered = 0;
2037  unsigned char i2cSlaveAddress;
2038  int slaveAddrStatus = 0;
2039 
2040  if (pDevCtx == NULL)
2041  {
2042  return RLS_RET_CODE_NULL_PTR_ERROR;
2043  }
2044 
2045  /* wait for Port B to be free */
2046  WaitForSingleObject(rls_gIrqI2cMutex, INFINITE);
2047 
2048  /*Purge USB receive buffer first before read operation*/
2049  /*Get the number of bytes in the device receive buffer*/
2050  ftStatus = FT_GetQueueStatus(pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle, &i2cBytesToTransfer);
2051  if ((ftStatus == FT_OK) && (i2cBytesToTransfer > 0))
2052  {
2053  /*Read out all the data from receive buffer*/
2054  FT_Read(pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle, i2cBuffer, i2cBytesToTransfer,
2055  &i2cBytesTransfered);
2056  }
2057 
2058  ftStatus = FT_OK;
2059 
2060  /*Set START condition for I2C communication*/
2061  rlsHighSpeedSetI2CStart(i2cBuffer, &i2cBytesToTransfer);
2062 
2063  /*Setting Bit 0 to one to enable read*/
2064  i2cSlaveAddress = (i2cAddr[pDevCtx->deviceIndex] << 1) | 0x01;
2065 
2066  /*Send slave address for read and check ACK bit*/
2067  status = rlsI2CSendByteAndCheckACK(pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle, i2cBuffer,
2068  &i2cBytesToTransfer, &i2cBytesTransfered,
2069  i2cSlaveAddress);
2070 
2071  slaveAddrStatus = status;
2072 
2073  for (i = 0; i < ReadLength - 1; i++)
2074  {
2075  /* Reading the data */
2076  status = rlsI2CReadByteAndSendACK(pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle, i2cBuffer, \
2077  &i2cBytesToTransfer, &i2cBytesTransfered, &preadbuffer[i]);
2078  }
2079  /* Reading Last data */
2080  status = rlsI2CReadByteAndSendNACK(pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle, i2cBuffer, \
2081  &i2cBytesToTransfer, &i2cBytesTransfered, &preadbuffer[i]);
2082 
2083  /*Set STOP condition for I2C communication*/
2084  rlsHighSpeedSetI2CStop(i2cBuffer, &i2cBytesToTransfer);
2085 
2086  /*Send off the commands*/
2087  ftStatus |= FT_Write(pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle, i2cBuffer, i2cBytesToTransfer, \
2088  &i2cBytesTransfered);
2089  i2cBytesToTransfer = 0; /*Clear output buffer*/
2090 
2091  /* Create data buffer and print it into file */
2092  char tempBuff[2048] = { 0 };
2093  int offset = 0;
2094  for (i = 0; i < ReadLength; i++)
2095  {
2096  int j = 0;
2097  j = sprintf(&tempBuff[offset], "0x%02X ", preadbuffer[i]);
2098  offset = offset + j;
2099  }
2100  sprintf(&tempBuff[offset], "\r\n");
2101  DEBUG_PRINT("Device [%d] [RD]%s", pDevCtx->deviceIndex, tempBuff);
2102 
2103  Sleep(1); /*Delay for a while to ensure read is completed*/
2104 
2105  /* Signal that the port B can be used*/
2106  ReleaseMutex(rls_gIrqI2cMutex);
2107 
2108  if (status == 1)
2109  status = ReadLength;
2110  else
2111  status = 0;
2112 
2113  return status;
2114 }
2115 
2127 int rlsI2cWrite( rlsDevHandle_t hdl, unsigned char *pwriteBuffer,
2128  unsigned short WriteLength )
2129 {
2130  rlsDevCtx_t* pDevCtx = (rlsDevCtx_t*)hdl;
2131  FT_STATUS ftStatus = FT_OK;
2132  int status = 0;
2133  unsigned char i = 0;
2134  BYTE i2cBuffer[100];
2135  DWORD i2cBytesToTransfer = 0;
2136  DWORD i2cBytesTransfered = 0;
2137  unsigned char i2cSlaveAddress;
2138  int slaveAddrStatus = 0;
2139 
2140  if (pDevCtx == NULL)
2141  {
2142  return RLS_RET_CODE_NULL_PTR_ERROR;
2143  }
2144 
2145  /* wait for Port B to be free */
2146  WaitForSingleObject(rls_gIrqI2cMutex, INFINITE);
2147  /*Setting Bit 0 to zero to enable write*/
2148  i2cSlaveAddress = (i2cAddr[pDevCtx->deviceIndex] << 1) & 0xFE;
2149 
2150  /*Set START condition for I2C communication*/
2151  rlsHighSpeedSetI2CStart(i2cBuffer, &i2cBytesToTransfer);
2152 
2153  /*Send off the commands*/
2154  ftStatus |= FT_Write(pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle, i2cBuffer, i2cBytesToTransfer, \
2155  &i2cBytesTransfered);
2156  i2cBytesToTransfer = 0; /*Clear output buffer*/
2157 
2158  /*Address of I2C slave for write*/
2159  status = rlsI2CSendByteAndCheckACK(pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle, i2cBuffer, \
2160  &i2cBytesToTransfer, &i2cBytesTransfered, \
2161  i2cSlaveAddress);
2162 
2163  slaveAddrStatus = status;
2164 
2165  for (i = 0; i < WriteLength; i++)
2166  {
2167  status = rlsI2CSendByteAndCheckACK(pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle, i2cBuffer, \
2168  &i2cBytesToTransfer, &i2cBytesTransfered, pwriteBuffer[i]);
2169  }
2170 
2171  if (status == 0)
2172  {
2173  DEBUG_PRINT("Error in I2C Write");
2174  }
2175 
2176  /*Set STOP condition for I2C communication*/
2177  rlsHighSpeedSetI2CStop(i2cBuffer, &i2cBytesToTransfer);
2178 
2179  /*Send off the commands*/
2180  ftStatus |= FT_Write(pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle, i2cBuffer, i2cBytesToTransfer, \
2181  &i2cBytesTransfered);
2182  i2cBytesToTransfer = 0; /*Clear output buffer*/
2183 
2184  /* Create data buffer and print it into file */
2185  char tempBuff[2048] = { 0 };
2186  int offset = 0;
2187  for (i = 0; i < WriteLength; i++)
2188  {
2189  int j = 0;
2190  j = sprintf(&tempBuff[offset], "0x%02X ", pwriteBuffer[i]);
2191  offset = offset + j;
2192  }
2193  sprintf(&tempBuff[offset], "\r\n");
2194  DEBUG_PRINT("Device [%d] [WR]%s", pDevCtx->deviceIndex, tempBuff);
2195 
2196  Sleep(1); /*Delay for a while to ensure read is completed*/
2197 
2198  /* Signal that the port B can be used*/
2199  ReleaseMutex(rls_gIrqI2cMutex);
2200 
2201  if (status == 1)
2202  status = WriteLength;
2203  else
2204  status = 0;
2205 
2206  return status;
2207 }
2208 
2209 rlsDevHandle_t rlsGetDeviceCtx( unsigned char deviceIndex )
2210 {
2211  rlsDevCtx_t* pDevCtx = NULL;
2212 
2213  if (deviceIndex < RLS_NUM_CONNECTED_DEVICES_MAX)
2214  {
2215  pDevCtx = &(rls_devCtx[deviceIndex]);
2216  pDevCtx->deviceIndex = deviceIndex;
2217  }
2218 
2219  return (rlsDevHandle_t)pDevCtx;
2220 }

2222 int rlsGetNumofDevices( int *numOfDevices )
2223 {
2224  FT_STATUS ftStatus;
2225  FT_DEVICE_LIST_INFO_NODE* pInfoList;
2226  DWORD numOfFTDIDevices;
2227  DWORD loopCounter;
2228 
2229  ftStatus = FT_CreateDeviceInfoList(&numOfFTDIDevices);
2230  if (FT_OK != ftStatus)
2231  {
2232  DEBUG_PRINT("Error requesting dev list from D2XX driver \n");
2233  return RLS_RET_CODE_DEVICE_NOT_FOUND;
2234  }
2235 
2236  pInfoList = (FT_DEVICE_LIST_INFO_NODE*) \
2237  malloc(sizeof(FT_DEVICE_LIST_INFO_NODE) * numOfFTDIDevices);
2238  if (NULL == pInfoList)
2239  {
2240  DEBUG_PRINT("malloc error during read device list\n");
2241  return RLS_RET_CODE_MALLOC_FAILED;
2242  }
2243 
2244  /* Get Device Information List */
2245  ftStatus = FT_GetDeviceInfoList(pInfoList, &numOfFTDIDevices);
2246  if (FT_OK != ftStatus)
2247  {
2248  DEBUG_PRINT("Error requesting dev list from D2XX driver \n");
2249  free(pInfoList);
2250  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_RD_ERROR;
2251  }
2252 
2253  *numOfDevices = 0;
2254  /* Search for SPI and IRQ device in the List */
2255  for (loopCounter = 0; loopCounter < numOfFTDIDevices; loopCounter++)
2256  {
2257  if ((memcmp(pInfoList[loopCounter].Description,
2258  &rls_mmWaveMotherBoard[0], strlen(rls_mmWaveMotherBoard)) == 0) ||
2259  (memcmp(pInfoList[loopCounter].Description,
2260  &rls_mmWaveDevPack[0], strlen(rls_mmWaveDevPack)) == 0))
2261  {
2262  (*numOfDevices)++;
2263  }
2264  }
2265  *numOfDevices = *numOfDevices / 4;
2266 
2267  return RLS_RET_CODE_OK;
2268 }
2269 
2278 int rlsWarmReset( rlsDevHandle_t hdl, int state )
2279 {
2280  rlsDevCtx_t* pDevCtx = (rlsDevCtx_t*)hdl;
2281  FT_STATUS ftStatus;
2282  unsigned char buffer[16];
2283  DWORD BytesToTransfer;
2284  DWORD BytesTransfered;
2285  int error = RLS_RET_CODE_OK;
2286  FT_HANDLE Hdl = 0;
2287 
2288  if(pDevCtx == NULL)
2289  {
2290  return RLS_RET_CODE_NULL_PTR_ERROR;
2291  }
2292 
2293  Hdl = pDevCtx->boardControlHandle ;
2294 
2295  if(Hdl != 0)
2296  {
2297  BytesToTransfer = 1;
2298 
2299  /* Read Board Control Port(C)*/
2300  ftStatus = FT_GetBitMode( Hdl, &buffer[0] );
2301  if ((ftStatus != FT_OK))
2302  {
2303  DEBUG_PRINT("Error - Port C cannot be read\n");
2304  /* Reset the port*/
2305  FT_SetBitMode( Hdl, RLS_PORTC_CONFIG, FT_BITMODE_RESET );
2306  FT_Close( Hdl ) ; /* Close the USB port*/
2307  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_WR_ERROR ; /* Exit with error*/
2308  }
2309 
2310  /* Warm reset value ie C7=1 */
2311  BytesToTransfer = 0;
2312 
2313  if (state == 1)
2314  {
2315  /*Setting C7 to one*/
2316  buffer[BytesToTransfer++] = \
2317  RLS_SET_BIT(buffer[0], RLS_PORTC_PIN7_WARMRST);
2318  }
2319  else
2320  {
2321  /* Setting C7 to 0 */
2322  buffer[BytesToTransfer++] = \
2323  RLS_CLR_BIT(buffer[0], RLS_PORTC_PIN7_WARMRST);
2324  }
2325 
2326  /*Writing value to buffer*/
2327  ftStatus = FT_Write( Hdl, buffer, BytesToTransfer, &BytesTransfered );
2328 
2329  if (ftStatus != FT_OK)
2330  {
2331  DEBUG_PRINT("Error - Warm Reset- C7 pin cannot be written\n");
2332  /* Reset the port*/
2333  FT_SetBitMode( Hdl, RLS_PORTC_CONFIG, FT_BITMODE_RESET );
2334  FT_Close( Hdl ) ; /* Close the USB port*/
2335  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_WR_ERROR ; /*Exit with error*/
2336  }
2337  }
2338  else
2339  {
2340  return RLS_RET_CODE_NULL_PTR_ERROR;
2341  }
2342 
2343  return RLS_RET_CODE_OK;
2344 }
2345 
2354 int rlsSOPControl( rlsDevHandle_t hdl, int SOPmode )
2355 {
2356  rlsDevCtx_t* pDevCtx = (rlsDevCtx_t*)hdl;
2357  FT_STATUS ftStatus;
2358  unsigned char buffer[16];
2359  DWORD BytesToTransfer;
2360  DWORD BytesTransfered;
2361  FT_HANDLE Hdl;
2362  int sopPin[3];
2363  int error = RLS_RET_CODE_OK;
2364 
2365  Hdl = pDevCtx->genericGPIOHandle;
2366  sopPin[0] = RLS_PORTD_PIN2_PMIC_OUT_SOR1;
2367  sopPin[1] = RLS_PORTD_PIN3_SYNC_OUT_SOR2;
2368  sopPin[2] = RLS_PORTD_PIN4_TDO_SOR3;
2369 
2370  rls_spiPhase = 0;
2371 
2372  if(pDevCtx == NULL)
2373  {
2374  return RLS_RET_CODE_NULL_PTR_ERROR;
2375  }
2376 
2377  if(Hdl != 0)
2378  {
2379  /*Reading Port D*/
2380  ftStatus = FT_GetBitMode( Hdl, &buffer[0] );
2381  if (ftStatus != FT_OK)
2382  {
2383  DEBUG_PRINT("Error - Port D cannot be read\n");
2384  /* Reset the port*/
2385  FT_SetBitMode( Hdl, RLS_PORTD_CONFIG, FT_BITMODE_RESET );
2386  FT_Close( Hdl ) ; /* Close the USB port*/
2387  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_WR_ERROR ; /* Exit with error*/
2388  }
2389 
2390  /*Setting the SOP pins depending on SOPmode*/
2391  BytesToTransfer = 1;
2392  if( SOPmode == RLS_SOP_MODE_SCAN_APTG ) /*SOP MODE 1 SCAN/ATPG*/
2393  {
2394  RLS_CLR_BIT(buffer[0], sopPin[0]) ; /*Setting D2 to 0*/
2395  RLS_SET_BIT(buffer[0], sopPin[1]) ; /*Setting D3 to 1*/
2396  RLS_CLR_BIT(buffer[0], sopPin[2]) ; /*Setting D4 to 0*/
2397  }
2398  else if( SOPmode == RLS_SOP_MODE_DEVELOPMENT ) /*SOP MODE 2 DEV/FLED/ORBIT*/
2399  {
2400  RLS_CLR_BIT(buffer[0], sopPin[0]) ; /*Setting D2 to 0*/
2401  RLS_SET_BIT(buffer[0], sopPin[1]) ; /*Setting D3 to 1*/
2402  RLS_SET_BIT(buffer[0], sopPin[2]) ; /*Setting D4 to 1*/
2403  }
2404  else if( SOPmode == RLS_SOP_MODE_THB ) /*SOP MODE 3 THB*/
2405  {
2406  RLS_CLR_BIT(buffer[0], sopPin[0]) ; /*Setting D2 to 0*/
2407  RLS_CLR_BIT(buffer[0], sopPin[1]) ; /*Setting D3 to 0*/
2408  RLS_CLR_BIT(buffer[0], sopPin[2]) ; /*Setting D4 to 0*/
2409  }
2410  else if( SOPmode == RLS_SOP_MODE_FUNCTIONAL) /*SOP MODE 4 Functional Mode*/
2411  {
2412  RLS_CLR_BIT(buffer[0], sopPin[0]) ; /*Setting D2 to 0*/
2413  RLS_CLR_BIT(buffer[0], sopPin[1]) ; /*Setting D3 to 0*/
2414  RLS_SET_BIT(buffer[0], sopPin[2]) ; /*Setting D4 to 1*/
2415  }
2416  else if ( SOPmode == RLS_SOP_MODE_FLASH_DOWNLOAD) /*SOP MODE 5 Device Management Mode*/
2417  {
2418  RLS_SET_BIT(buffer[0], sopPin[0]) ; /*Setting D2 to 1*/
2419  RLS_CLR_BIT(buffer[0], sopPin[1]) ; /*Setting D3 to 0*/
2420  RLS_SET_BIT(buffer[0], sopPin[2]) ; /*Setting D4 to 1*/
2421  }
2422  else if ( SOPmode == RLS_SOP_MODE_FUNCTIONAL_CPHA1) /*SOP MODE 6 Functional SPI CPHA1 mode*/
2423  {
2424  RLS_SET_BIT(buffer[0], sopPin[0]) ; /*Setting D2 to 1*/
2425  RLS_SET_BIT(buffer[0], sopPin[1]) ; /*Setting D3 to 1*/
2426  RLS_CLR_BIT(buffer[0], sopPin[2]) ; /*Setting D4 to 0*/
2427 
2428  rls_spiPhase = 1;
2429  }
2430  else if (SOPmode == RLS_SOP_MODE_FUNCTIONAL_I2C) /*SOP MODE 7 Functional I2C mode*/
2431  {
2432  RLS_SET_BIT(buffer[0], sopPin[0]); /*Setting D2 to 1*/
2433  RLS_SET_BIT(buffer[0], sopPin[1]); /*Setting D3 to 1*/
2434  RLS_SET_BIT(buffer[0], sopPin[2]); /*Setting D4 to 1*/
2435  }
2436  else
2437  {
2438  DEBUG_PRINT("Wrong SOP state is given");
2439  return -1;
2440  }
2441  /*Writing value to buffer*/
2442  ftStatus = FT_Write( Hdl, buffer, BytesToTransfer, &BytesTransfered );
2443  if (ftStatus != FT_OK)
2444  {
2445  DEBUG_PRINT("Error - Port D cannot be read\n");
2446  /* Reset the port*/
2447  FT_SetBitMode( Hdl, RLS_PORTD_CONFIG, FT_BITMODE_RESET );
2448  FT_Close( Hdl ) ; /* Close the USB port*/
2449  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_WR_ERROR ; /* Exit with error*/
2450  }
2451  }
2452  return RLS_RET_CODE_OK;
2453 }
2454 
2463 int rlsFullReset(rlsDevHandle_t hdl, int state )
2464 {
2465  rlsDevCtx_t* pDevCtx = (rlsDevCtx_t*)hdl;
2466  FT_STATUS ftStatus;
2467  unsigned char buffer[16];
2468  DWORD BytesToTransfer;
2469  DWORD BytesTransfered;
2470  FT_HANDLE Hdl;
2471  unsigned char portConfig;
2472  int pinnum;
2473  int error = RLS_RET_CODE_OK;
2474 
2475  Hdl = pDevCtx->boardControlHandle;
2476  portConfig = RLS_PORTC_CONFIG;
2477  pinnum = RLS_PORTC_PIN6_12XX_1_2_NRST;
2478 
2479  if (pDevCtx == NULL)
2480  {
2481  return RLS_RET_CODE_NULL_PTR_ERROR;
2482  }
2483 
2484  if ((Hdl != 0))
2485  {
2486  BytesToTransfer = 1;
2487 
2488  /* Read Board Control Port(C)*/
2489  ftStatus = FT_GetBitMode(Hdl, &buffer[0]);
2490  if ((ftStatus != FT_OK))
2491  {
2492  DEBUG_PRINT("Error - Port C cannot be read\n");
2493  /* Reset the port*/
2494  FT_SetBitMode(Hdl, portConfig, FT_BITMODE_RESET);
2495  FT_Close(Hdl); /* Close the USB port*/
2496  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_WR_ERROR; /* Exit with error */
2497  }
2498 
2499  /*Full reset value ie C6=1*/
2500  BytesToTransfer = 0;
2501 
2502  if (state == 1)
2503  {
2504  /* Setting C6 to one */
2505  buffer[BytesToTransfer++] = RLS_SET_BIT(buffer[0], pinnum);
2506  }
2507  else
2508  {
2509  /*Setting C6 to 0*/
2510  buffer[BytesToTransfer++] = RLS_CLR_BIT(buffer[0], pinnum);
2511  }
2512 
2513  /*Writing value to buffer*/
2514  ftStatus = FT_Write(Hdl, buffer, BytesToTransfer, &BytesTransfered);
2515  if (ftStatus != FT_OK)
2516  {
2517  DEBUG_PRINT("Error - Warm Reset- C6 pin cannot be written\n");
2518  /* Reset port*/
2519  FT_SetBitMode(Hdl, portConfig, FT_BITMODE_RESET);
2520  FT_Close(Hdl); /* Close port*/
2521  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_WR_ERROR; /* Exit */
2522  }
2523  }
2524 
2525  else
2526  {
2527  return RLS_RET_CODE_NULL_PTR_ERROR;
2528  }
2529 
2530  /*wait*/
2531  Sleep(2);
2532 
2533  return RLS_RET_CODE_OK;
2534 }
2535 
2544 int rlsOpenBoardControlIf(rlsDevHandle_t hdl )
2545 {
2546  rlsDevCtx_t* pDevCtx = (rlsDevCtx_t*)hdl;
2547  FT_STATUS ftStatus;
2548  DWORD numOfDevices;
2549  FT_DEVICE_LIST_INFO_NODE* pInfoList;
2550  DWORD loopCounter;
2551  int boardControlDevNumber;
2552 
2553  if (pDevCtx == NULL)
2554  {
2555  return RLS_RET_CODE_NULL_PTR_ERROR;
2556  }
2557 
2558  if (pDevCtx->boardControlHandle == 0)
2559  {
2560  /* Create Device Information List */
2561  ftStatus = FT_CreateDeviceInfoList(&numOfDevices);
2562  if (FT_OK != ftStatus)
2563  {
2564  DEBUG_PRINT("Error requesting dev list from D2XX driver \n");
2565  return RLS_RET_CODE_DEVICE_NOT_FOUND;
2566  }
2567 
2568  pInfoList = (FT_DEVICE_LIST_INFO_NODE*)
2569  malloc(sizeof(FT_DEVICE_LIST_INFO_NODE) * numOfDevices);
2570  if (NULL == pInfoList)
2571  {
2572  DEBUG_PRINT("malloc error during read device list\n");
2573  return RLS_RET_CODE_MALLOC_FAILED;
2574  }
2575 
2576  /* Get Device Information List */
2577  ftStatus = FT_GetDeviceInfoList(pInfoList, &numOfDevices);
2578  if (FT_OK != ftStatus)
2579  {
2580  DEBUG_PRINT("Error requesting dev list from D2XX driver \n");
2581  free(pInfoList);
2582  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_RD_ERROR;
2583  }
2584 
2585  DEBUG_PRINT("rlsOpenBoardControlIf: Got %d devices connected \n",
2586  numOfDevices);
2587 
2588  boardControlDevNumber = -1;
2589 
2590  /* Search for SPI and IRQ device in the List */
2591  for (loopCounter = 0; loopCounter < numOfDevices; loopCounter++)
2592  {
2593  if ((memcmp(rls_BoardControlDeviceName[pDevCtx->deviceIndex], \
2594  pInfoList[loopCounter].Description, \
2595  strlen(rls_BoardControlDeviceName[pDevCtx->deviceIndex])) == 0) \
2596  || \
2597  (memcmp(rls_BoardControlDeviceNameDevPack[pDevCtx->deviceIndex],
2598  pInfoList[loopCounter].Description, \
2599  strlen(rls_BoardControlDeviceNameDevPack[pDevCtx->deviceIndex]))== 0))
2600  {
2601  /* Found Board Control FTDI Device */
2602  if ((pInfoList[loopCounter].Flags & FT_FLAGS_OPENED) == 0)
2603  {
2604  boardControlDevNumber = loopCounter;
2605  }
2606  }
2607  }
2608 
2609  free(pInfoList);
2610  if (boardControlDevNumber == -1)
2611  {
2612  DEBUG_PRINT("Error while opening the board control\n");
2613  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_OPEN_ERROR;
2614  }
2615 
2616  ftStatus = FT_Open(boardControlDevNumber, &pDevCtx->boardControlHandle);
2617  if (ftStatus != FT_OK)
2618  {
2619  DEBUG_PRINT("Board Control port open error\n");
2620  pDevCtx->boardControlHandle = 0;
2621  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_OPEN_ERROR;
2622  }
2623 
2624  /* Initialize Board Control device */
2625  if (0 != rlsInitBoardControlPort(pDevCtx))
2626  {
2627  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_OPEN_ERROR;
2628  }
2629  }
2630 
2631  return RLS_RET_CODE_OK;
2632 }
2633 
2642 int rlsCloseBoardControlIf(rlsDevHandle_t hdl )
2643 {
2644  FT_STATUS ftStatus;
2645  rlsDevCtx_t* pDevCtx = (rlsDevCtx_t*)hdl;
2646  int error = RLS_RET_CODE_OK;
2647 
2648  if (pDevCtx == NULL)
2649  {
2650  return RLS_RET_CODE_NULL_PTR_ERROR;
2651  }
2652 
2653  if ((pDevCtx->boardControlHandle != 0))
2654  {
2655  ftStatus = FT_SetBitMode(pDevCtx->boardControlHandle, 0x0,
2656  FT_BITMODE_RESET);
2657  ftStatus = FT_ResetPort(pDevCtx->boardControlHandle);
2658  ftStatus = FT_Close(pDevCtx->boardControlHandle);
2659  pDevCtx->boardControlHandle = 0;
2660  }
2661 
2662  return RLS_RET_CODE_OK;
2663 }
2664 
2673 int rlsOpenGenericGpioIf(rlsDevHandle_t hdl )
2674 {
2675  rlsDevCtx_t* pDevCtx = (rlsDevCtx_t*)hdl;
2676  FT_STATUS ftStatus;
2677  DWORD numOfDevices;
2678  FT_DEVICE_LIST_INFO_NODE* pInfoList;
2679  DWORD loopCounter;
2680  int genericGPIODevNumber;
2681  if (pDevCtx == NULL)
2682  {
2683  return RLS_RET_CODE_NULL_PTR_ERROR;
2684  }
2685 
2686  if ((pDevCtx->genericGPIOHandle == 0))
2687  {
2688  /* Create Device Information List */
2689  ftStatus = FT_CreateDeviceInfoList(&numOfDevices);
2690  if (FT_OK != ftStatus)
2691  {
2692  DEBUG_PRINT("Error requesting dev list from D2XX driver \n");
2693  return RLS_RET_CODE_DEVICE_NOT_FOUND;
2694  }
2695 
2696  pInfoList = (FT_DEVICE_LIST_INFO_NODE*)
2697  malloc(sizeof(FT_DEVICE_LIST_INFO_NODE) * numOfDevices);
2698  if (NULL == pInfoList)
2699  {
2700  DEBUG_PRINT("malloc error during read device list\n");
2701  return RLS_RET_CODE_MALLOC_FAILED;
2702  }
2703 
2704  /* Get Device Information List */
2705  ftStatus = FT_GetDeviceInfoList(pInfoList, &numOfDevices);
2706  if (FT_OK != ftStatus)
2707  {
2708  DEBUG_PRINT("Error requesting dev list from D2XX driver \n");
2709  free(pInfoList);
2710  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_RD_ERROR;
2711  }
2712 
2713  DEBUG_PRINT("rlsOpenGenericGpioIf: Got %d devices connected \n",
2714  numOfDevices);
2715 
2716  genericGPIODevNumber = -1;
2717 
2718  /* Search for SPI and IRQ device in the List */
2719  for (loopCounter = 0; loopCounter < numOfDevices; loopCounter++)
2720  {
2721  if ((memcmp(rls_GenericGPIODeviceName[pDevCtx->deviceIndex], \
2722  pInfoList[loopCounter].Description, \
2723  strlen(rls_GenericGPIODeviceName[pDevCtx->deviceIndex])) == 0) || \
2724  (memcmp(rls_GenericGPIODeviceNameDevPack[pDevCtx->deviceIndex],
2725  pInfoList[loopCounter].Description, \
2726  strlen(rls_GenericGPIODeviceNameDevPack[pDevCtx->deviceIndex])) == 0))
2727  {
2728  /* Found Generic GPIO Control FTDI Device */
2729  if ((pInfoList[loopCounter].Flags & FT_FLAGS_OPENED) == 0)
2730  {
2731  genericGPIODevNumber = loopCounter;
2732  }
2733  }
2734  }
2735 
2736  free(pInfoList);
2737  if (genericGPIODevNumber == -1)
2738  {
2739  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_OPEN_ERROR;
2740  }
2741 
2742  ftStatus = FT_Open(genericGPIODevNumber, &pDevCtx->genericGPIOHandle);
2743  if (ftStatus != FT_OK)
2744  {
2745  DEBUG_PRINT("GPIO Control port open error\n");
2746  pDevCtx->genericGPIOHandle = 0;
2747  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_OPEN_ERROR;
2748  }
2749  /* Initialize Generic GPIO device */
2750  if (0 != rlsInitGenericGPIOPort(pDevCtx))
2751  {
2752  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_OPEN_ERROR;
2753  }
2754  }
2755 
2756  return RLS_RET_CODE_OK;
2757 }
2758 
2767 int rlsCloseGenericGpioIf(rlsDevHandle_t hdl )
2768 {
2769  FT_STATUS ftStatus;
2770  rlsDevCtx_t* pDevCtx = (rlsDevCtx_t*)hdl;
2771  int error = RLS_RET_CODE_OK;
2772 
2773  if (pDevCtx == NULL)
2774  {
2775  return RLS_RET_CODE_NULL_PTR_ERROR;
2776  }
2777 
2778  if ((pDevCtx->genericGPIOHandle != 0))
2779  {
2780  ftStatus = FT_SetBitMode(pDevCtx->genericGPIOHandle, 0x0,
2781  FT_BITMODE_RESET);
2782  ftStatus = FT_ResetPort(pDevCtx->genericGPIOHandle);
2783  ftStatus = FT_Close(pDevCtx->genericGPIOHandle);
2784  pDevCtx->genericGPIOHandle = 0;
2785  }
2786 
2787  return RLS_RET_CODE_OK;
2788 }
2789 
2798 int rlsOpenI2cIrqIf(rlsDevHandle_t hdl )
2799 {
2800  rlsDevCtx_t* pDevCtx = (rlsDevCtx_t*)hdl;
2801  FT_STATUS ftStatus;
2802  DWORD numOfDevices;
2803  FT_DEVICE_LIST_INFO_NODE* pInfoList;
2804  DWORD loopCounter;
2805  int i2cIrqDevNumber;
2806 
2807  if (pDevCtx == NULL)
2808  {
2809  return RLS_RET_CODE_NULL_PTR_ERROR;
2810  }
2811 
2812  if ((pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle == 0))
2813  {
2814  /* Create Device Information List */
2815  ftStatus = FT_CreateDeviceInfoList(&numOfDevices);
2816  if (FT_OK != ftStatus)
2817  {
2818  DEBUG_PRINT("Error requesting dev list from D2XX driver \n");
2819  return RLS_RET_CODE_DEVICE_NOT_FOUND;
2820  }
2821 
2822  pInfoList = (FT_DEVICE_LIST_INFO_NODE*)
2823  malloc(sizeof(FT_DEVICE_LIST_INFO_NODE) * numOfDevices);
2824  if (NULL == pInfoList)
2825  {
2826  DEBUG_PRINT("malloc error during read device list\n");
2827  return RLS_RET_CODE_MALLOC_FAILED;
2828  }
2829 
2830  /* Get Device Information List */
2831  ftStatus = FT_GetDeviceInfoList(pInfoList, &numOfDevices);
2832  if (FT_OK != ftStatus)
2833  {
2834  DEBUG_PRINT("Error requesting dev list from D2XX driver \n");
2835  free(pInfoList);
2836  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_RD_ERROR;
2837  }
2838 
2839  DEBUG_PRINT("rlsOpenI2cIrqIf: Got %d devices connected\n",
2840  numOfDevices);
2841 
2842  i2cIrqDevNumber = -1;
2843 
2844  /* Search for SPI and IRQ device in the List */
2845  for (loopCounter = 0; loopCounter < numOfDevices; loopCounter++)
2846  {
2847  if ((memcmp(rls_irqI2CDeviceName[pDevCtx->deviceIndex], \
2848  pInfoList[loopCounter].Description, \
2849  strlen(rls_irqI2CDeviceName[pDevCtx->deviceIndex])) == 0) || \
2850  (memcmp(rls_irqI2CDeviceNameDevPack[pDevCtx->deviceIndex], \
2851  pInfoList[loopCounter].Description, \
2852  strlen(rls_irqI2CDeviceNameDevPack[pDevCtx->deviceIndex])) == 0))
2853  {
2854  /* Found Generic GPIO Control FTDI Device */
2855  if ((pInfoList[loopCounter].Flags & FT_FLAGS_OPENED) == 0)
2856  {
2857  i2cIrqDevNumber = loopCounter;
2858  }
2859  }
2860  }
2861 
2862  free(pInfoList);
2863  if (i2cIrqDevNumber == -1)
2864  {
2865  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_OPEN_ERROR;
2866  }
2867 
2868  ftStatus = FT_Open(i2cIrqDevNumber, &pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle);
2869  if (ftStatus != FT_OK)
2870  {
2871  DEBUG_PRINT("GPIO Control port open error\n");
2872  pDevCtx->irqI2cHandle = 0;
2873  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_OPEN_ERROR;
2874  }
2875  /* Initialize Generic GPIO device */
2876  if (0 != rlsInitIrqI2CPort(pDevCtx))
2877  {
2878  return RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_OPEN_ERROR;
2879  }
2880  }
2881 
2882  return RLS_RET_CODE_OK;
2883 }
2884
